arpi.about.title: ArPI - Raspberry PI based home security system
arpi.about.description: Only replacing the main board of your old security system and reuse the installed components (sensors, syren, keypad) you can make your home security system smart. The system has two major components: an adapter component for interfacing between the Raspberry PI and the security system components and the open source software to configure and use the system.
arpi.features.ui.title: User interface
arpi.features.ui.description: Use and configure your home security system with an easy to use web application from mobile or desktop.
arpi.features.ui.description1: You can test a demo version of the ArPI web application in a simulated environment.
arpi.features.channels.title: Channels
arpi.features.channels.description: You can attach 15 sensor to monitor and alert.
arpi.features.rtc.title: Real time clock
arpi.features.rtc.description: You can attach a real-time clock to have a precise time without internet connection.
arpi.features.ups.title: Power supply
arpi.features.ups.description: You can connect an uninterruptible power supply and detect power outages.
arpi.features.keypad.title: Keypad
arpi.features.keypad.description: You can connect a Wiegand protocol based keypad to control the security system.
arpi.features.outputs.title: Outputs
arpi.features.outputs.description: You have two outputs for the syren, two programmable relay outputs and 4 programmable open collector outputs.
arpi.features.gsm.title: GSM
arpi.features.gsm.description: You can get notifications in SMS.
